name: Rackspace Fabric
description: Proprietary multi-tenant software platform providing unified administrative experience across multicloud environments. Integrates service management, portals, billing, authentication, ticketing, tagging and automation into a single platform. Built on 20+ years of operational expertise. Provides common governance layer across AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, VMware and on-premises deployments without replacing native cloud access. Foundation of Rackspace's service delivery model per company product pages.

name: Rackspace Spot
description: Cloud infrastructure platform delivering fully managed Kubernetes clusters via real-time open market auction model with dynamic customer-driven bidding. Co-developed with Platform9 using Cluster API and Kamaji hosted control plane architecture. Launched March 19, 2024. Features auto-scaling node pools, Terraform provider, SSD and SATA persistent storage classes, Calico CNI, load balancers and GPU-as-a-Service (NVIDIA). Available in five global regions. Accessible at spot.rackspace.com per GlobeNewswire press release.

name: Rackspace Cloud Management Platform
description: Next-generation management platform launched August 5, 2025 providing single robust framework leveraging AI-enabled tools for workload operations, digital transformation and hybrid multicloud environment management. Includes full-stack observability, intelligent application optimization, SLA adherence, flexible consumption-based pricing model and integration with existing IT Service Management systems. Powers Rackspace Managed Cloud (RMC) offering. Supports AIOps tools and native cloud services per Rackspace newsroom.

name: Intelligent Co-worker for the Enterprise (ICE)
description: AI-powered copilot for go-to-market teams built using FAIR methodology. Automates routine tasks, identifies warm leads, surfaces relevant data and content, provides real-time contextualized analytics for hyper-personalized customer interactions. Initially implemented internally by Rackspace for Microsoft releases. Announced as part of AWS Strategic Collaboration Agreement for launch in AWS Marketplace starting early 2025 per IR press release.

name: Rackspace Intelligent Technology Assistant (RITA)
description: AI-powered interactive chatbot built using FAIR methodology and integrated OpenAI language models. Automates and transforms IT operations by answering text-based IT service requests, enhancing self-service capabilities for inquiries, processing hardware and software requests, resetting forgotten passwords and answering questions on IT and security policies. Links responses to specific sections of source documents for resolution. Announced alongside ICE as part of AWS SCA per IR press release.

name: Rackspace Email
description: Business-class hosted email service providing professional email across Outlook, webmail and mobile devices. Priced at $10.00 USD per mailbox per month with optional Plus package adding unlimited archived email storage for additional $6.00 USD per mailbox per month. Includes 100% uptime guarantee, POP and IMAP access, Email Client Setup Tool, calendaring and contact features. 14-day free trial available. Reseller program available for hosting providers. Accessible at apps.rackspace.com per Rackspace product page.

name: Rackspace ObjectRocket (DBaaS)
description: Fully managed database-as-a-service platform acquired February 2013. Supports MongoDB, Redis and Elasticsearch instances across global data centers. Features proprietary POD architecture for seamless on-demand scaling, encrypted connections, IP-based access control, SSL authentication. Compatible with apps hosted on AWS, Azure and Rackspace Service Net. Rebranded as Rackspace DBaaS with ObjectRocket technology per rackspace.com/data/rackspace-dbaas. 30-day free trial available at objectrocket.com.

name: RackConnect Global
description: Software-defined hybrid multicloud interconnection platform providing private network connectivity between Rackspace data centers, third-party data centers and public clouds including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, OpenStack and VMware. Includes 24x7x365 support and 99.95% connectivity uptime guarantee. Lowers connectivity costs, improves resilience and enhances data privacy compared to public internet transit per Rackspace multicloud solutions page.

name: Rackspace Data Freedom
description: Storage disaggregation platform launched September 2021 enabling customers to decouple storage from public cloud compute, freeing data from unpredictable egress charges. Provides data sovereignty retention and multi-cloud data accessibility. Available globally in all Rackspace Technology data centers and colocation facilities. Connects to most cloud environments including VMware Cloud, AWS, Azure and Google Cloud Platform per Solutions Review coverage of launch announcement.

name: Rackspace OpenStack Enterprise
description: Fully-managed enterprise-ready cloud solution launched August 20, 2024 built from the ground up on OpenStack for secure, efficient and scalable workload performance. Part of Rackspace One OpenStack Strategy using single technology stream. Addresses security and compliance for sensitive data with data locality and sovereignty options. Backed by 5.6 million lines of OpenStack code contributions, 150+ OpenStack experts and 50+ Kubernetes administrators. Over one billion server hours of production experience per GlobeNewswire press release.

name: Rackspace OpenStack Flex
description: Enterprise-ready on-demand shared cloud service launched April 10, 2025 providing secure open Infrastructure-as-a-Service. Multi-tenant IaaS bridging gap between dedicated and shared cloud solutions. License-free OpenStack-powered platform with high availability, fault tolerance and resiliency features. Includes 24x7 expert support and fully monitored infrastructure. Designed to work seamlessly with OpenStack Business for hybrid scaling per GlobeNewswire press release.

name: Rackspace OpenStack Business
description: Open-source dedicated private cloud launched July 8, 2025 for organizations running mission-critical or regulated workloads. Fully-managed single-tenant solution delivering enhanced performance, security and full operational support. Built for scalability with rapid deployment in hours versus weeks. Provides stable foundation for steady-state workloads complementing OpenStack Flex for burst capacity. Next-generation OpenStack-based architecture per Rackspace newsroom announcement.

name: Rackspace Cyber Recovery Cloud powered by Rubrik
description: Fully-managed subscription-based isolated recovery environment (IRE) for advanced cyber resilience announced April 30, 2025 at RSAC. Combines Rubrik data protection and cyber recovery software with Rackspace hybrid cloud infrastructure and global data center footprint. Replicates validated backups for secure rapid deployment; restores critical workloads within hours to air-gapped recovery environment separate from production and disaster recovery systems. Designed for regulated industries including BFSI and healthcare per Rackspace-Rubrik joint announcement.

name: Rackspace Data Protection
description: High-performance software-defined backup and recovery service powered by Cohesity DataProtect foundation. Announced April 7, 2022 as strategic partnership deliverable. Delivers managed backup and recovery across VMware-based clouds globally. Features global variable-length deduplication and compression to reduce data footprints and attack surface. Includes options for advisory services and ransomware anomaly detection and remediation. Integrates VMware Cloud Director (vCD) per Cohesity joint announcement.

name: Rackspace AI Launchpad
description: Secure managed service announced November 12, 2025 enabling organizations to evaluate, pilot and deploy AI workloads across healthcare, BFSI and energy industries. Three-phase approach: Proof of Concept (secure flexible environment for experimentation), Pilot (GPU-powered servers for production readiness), and Production (enterprise-grade AI environment built on AI Anywhere and AI Business solutions). Leverages NVIDIA GPU infrastructure and managed Kubernetes clusters per GlobeNewswire press release.

name: Rackspace Customer Portal
description: Self-service web portal for Rackspace Technology customers providing account management, service fee visibility, support ticket creation, live chat with specialists, billing management and infrastructure monitoring. Referenced across multiple Rackspace product pages as primary customer interaction point at login URL. Serves as unified access point alongside Cloud Office Control Panel and Microsoft 365 Portal per docs.rackspace.com.

name: Rackspace Webmail
description: Web-based email client interface for Rackspace Email customers providing browser-accessible email, calendaring and contact management features. Accessible at apps.rackspace.com with optimized mobile site at apps.rackspace.com/mobile. Supports POP and IMAP connections for desktop client integration per Rackspace webmail access page.

name: Optimizer+
description: Cloud cost optimization and FinOps tool providing visibility into cloud spending patterns, resource utilization analysis and actionable recommendations for cost reduction across multicloud environments. Supports AWS Reserved Instance and Spot Instance optimization. Referenced in Rackspace cloud optimization and FinOps services documentation as proprietary tooling per product portfolio references.

name: Rackspace Managed Platform for Kubernetes (MPK)
description: Unified multicloud Kubernetes management service powered by Platform9 Managed Kubernetes (PMK). Provides single pane of glass for deploying and managing clusters across private and public cloud (Rackspace bare metal, AWS EKS, Azure Kubernetes Service). Curated Rackspace Kubernetes Stack with Infrastructure, Certified and Catalog application categories. Supported by dedicated pods of CKA-certified engineers. Includes cluster monitoring, alerting, security management and performance optimization per rackspace.com/cloud/kubernetes.

name: Incubate with Amazon Q
description: AWS Marketplace offer helping organizations establish feasibility of AI in their business and adopt first generative AI use case powered by Amazon Q. Part of FAIR practice delivered through AWS Strategic Collaboration Agreement. Amazon Q provides generative AI-powered assistance for accelerating software development and leveraging internal company data per Rackspace-AWS SCA announcement on IR site.

name: Rackspace AI Anywhere
description: Private cloud AI/ML platform launched January 17, 2024 as first of four AI offerings for Rackspace Private Cloud. Merges cutting-edge AI/ML capabilities with data security and privacy emphasis. Leverages AI software stack with latest generation AI-optimized hardware. Deployable in customer-owned data centers, colocation facilities and third-party services. Powered by Dell and NVIDIA hardware with FAIR methodology integration. Serves as underlying infrastructure for AI Launchpad service per GlobeNewswire press release.

name: Rackspace AI Business
description: AI-optimized hybrid cloud platform announced March 25, 2025 engineered for enterprise AI training and inferencing workloads. Built on Dell Servers and NVIDIA GPUs. Three core capabilities: distributed training (multi-GPU, multi-node with efficient parallelization), scalable inferencing (real-time predictions with automated scaling for fluctuating workloads), and fine-tuning (pre-trained model adaptation for domain-specific tasks across multiple frameworks). Fully managed with enterprise-grade security per GlobeNewswire press release.

name: Rackspace Government Cloud (RGC)
description: Zero trust, FedRAMP Moderate Joint Authorization Board (JAB) authorized Platform-as-a-Service for government agencies and SaaS vendors selling to government. Available on public (AWS), private (VMware) or hybrid cloud IaaS. Holds JAB authorization since 2015 plus DoD Impact Level 4 and DFARS/CMMC attestations. Addresses 80% of FedRAMP ATO security requirements. Complies with FISMA, ITAR, Section 889, HIPAA and IRS Publication 1075. Powers solutions for more than half of Federal Cabinet-level agencies per rackspace.com/industry/government.

name: Rackspace Inheritable Security Controls (RISC)
description: FedRAMP compliance acceleration platform powered by Xacta reducing costs and shortening time to achieve Authorization to Operate (ATO) for ISVs and system integrators selling SaaS to federal government. Streamlines FedRAMP ATO path to as little as four months (3x faster than average). Provides inheritable security controls on FedRAMP authorized Rackspace Government Cloud PaaS per rackspace.com/fedramp public sector page.

name: Rackspace SDDC Solutions
description: Software-Defined Data Center platform combining VMware Cloud Foundation with Dell Technologies integration enabling organizations to run software and workloads without maintaining physical infrastructure. Includes VMware-based SDDC variants: Enterprise, Business, Flex, Anywhere and SAP-specific. Provides dedicated resources with predictable scalability and costs. Supported by full range of managed and professional services per rackspace.com private cloud SDDC solutions page.

name: Cloud Office Control Panel
description: Administrative web portal for managing Rackspace hosted email and productivity services including Rackspace Email mailboxes, Microsoft Exchange and Microsoft 365 configurations. Provides domain management, mailbox provisioning, email forwarding rules, distribution lists, spam filtering controls and billing management. Referenced across multiple Rackspace product pages as dedicated login portal alongside Customer Portal and Microsoft 365 Portal per rackspace.com site-wide navigation.

name: Microsoft Exchange Online Hosted by Rackspace
description: Fully managed Microsoft Exchange Online service delivered as part of the Cloud Office suite. Provides enterprise-grade hosted email, calendar, contacts, and collaboration with 99.999% uptime guarantee. Includes anti-spam and anti-malware protection, mobile device management, litigation hold and eDiscovery. Pricing starts at $10.85 per mailbox per month. Part of Rackspace's 25+ year Microsoft partnership. Accessible via Cloud Office Control Panel and Outlook client. Available in combination with Rackspace Email via Hybrid plan.

name: Microsoft 365 Managed by Rackspace
description: Fully managed Microsoft 365 service delivering enterprise productivity suite (Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Exchange Online, Office apps) with Rackspace Elastic Engineering for Microsoft 365 pods providing proactive management, security, governance, and feature adoption. Rackspace is a Microsoft Azure Expert MSP, Gold Partner, and Ready-Tier Copilot Jumpstart partner. 25+ year Microsoft partnership. ISG Provider Lens Leader for Microsoft AI and Cloud Ecosystem Global 2025. Enables Copilot readiness assessments and implementation.

name: Rackspace Microsoft Copilot Services
description: Managed services and advisory offerings for Microsoft 365 Copilot adoption, enabling enterprises to realize AI productivity value across Teams, Word, Excel, and Outlook. Delivered by Rackspace as Microsoft Ready-Tier Copilot Jumpstart partner. Includes Copilot readiness assessments, license management, data governance preparation, security posture review, and ongoing adoption optimization via Elastic Engineering for Microsoft 365 pods. Referenced in 10-K as strategic AI growth area.

name: Google Workspace Managed by Rackspace
description: Fully managed Google Workspace (formerly G Suite) service providing enterprise email, collaboration, and productivity tools including Gmail, Drive, Docs, Meet, and Calendar with Rackspace expert management. Delivered as part of Rackspace Public Cloud managed services. Rackspace holds 500+ GCP certifications and is a Google Cloud Premier Partner. Supports migration from Microsoft Exchange and other on-premises email platforms per Rackspace professional services capabilities.

name: Rackspace Flex Metal
description: On-demand bare metal infrastructure product providing dedicated single-tenant physical servers with rapid provisioning, no hypervisor overhead, and direct hardware access for performance-sensitive workloads. Available as part of Rackspace Private Cloud and OpenStack deployments. Supports GPU configurations for AI/ML workloads including NVIDIA H100 and A100 configurations. Foundation layer for Rackspace AI Anywhere and AI Business platforms. Consumed per-hour with no long-term commitments for flex configurations.

name: Rackspace DDoS Protection
description: Managed distributed denial-of-service mitigation service providing always-on or on-demand volumetric and application-layer attack protection. Part of Rackspace Network Security Services portfolio. Protects Rackspace-hosted infrastructure, colocation customers, and public cloud environments via BGP diversion and scrubbing center architecture. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security > Network Security Services on rackspace.com. Integrated with Elastic Engineering for Security for SOC-backed response.

name: Rackspace Managed Web Application Firewall (WAF)
description: Managed web application firewall service protecting customer web applications from OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, injection attacks, cross-site scripting, and bot traffic. Part of Rackspace Network Security Services portfolio. Available as managed service with 24x7x365 rule tuning, alert triage, and incident response by certified security engineers. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security > Network Security Services on rackspace.com. Integrates with AWS WAF, Azure Application Gateway, and dedicated hardware WAF options.
